metadata.title: Marcelo B. Diani | Senior Full Stack Developer
metadata.description: Senior Full Stack Developer & Team Lead with 7+ years of experience in JavaScript/TypeScript. Specialized in React, Node.js, Next.js, and AWS. USP Computer Engineering graduate.

hero.name: Marcelo B. Diani
hero.role: Senior Full Stack & DevOps | Team Lead | Founder | E-commerce & AI Specialist
hero.tagline: My mission is to improve people's lives through technology.

about.title: About Me
about.bio: Graduated in Computer Engineering at the University of São Paulo (USP), in São Carlos, Brazil (2019). Mathematics Olympiad medalist. Have been working for 7+ years mostly with JavaScript/TypeScript with strong experience in web development. E-commerce specialist on maximizing online sales. AI enthusiast. Always with a positive mindset.

beyondCode.subtitle: A little about my journey outside the screen

origins.title: Origins & Roots
origins.text: Born in 1996 in Mirassol, a small city in the countryside of São Paulo, Brazil. Descendant of Italian immigrants, I grew up in a humble and hardworking family. My dad fixes TVs, radios, and all kinds of electronics — watching him take things apart and put them back together sparked my curiosity about how everything is made.

school.title: School Years
school.text: I attended high school at an ETEC in São José do Rio Preto, one of the best public technical schools in the region — you had to pass a competitive exam to get in. During those years I won several math and physics medals, including a gold medal at the OBMEP national olympiad, where I traveled to Rio de Janeiro to receive it from the president's hands. I also received awards in my city for being one of the top students.

hobbies.title: Hobbies & Interests
hobbies.text: As a kid I played soccer a lot with friends — I was never that good, but it was always fun. I've always loved movies and spent countless hours playing video games. One game that stood out was Dota 2, which I consider a kind of "chess 2.0" — the strategy, teamwork, and decision-making it demands are unmatched.

path.title: The Path to Engineering
path.text: Before university, I took some courses on edX about physics and one about Python — that was my first real contact with programming. Being good at math and having an innate curiosity about how things work (thanks, Dad!), I decided to pursue Computer Engineering at the University of São Paulo (USP).

university.title: University Life
university.text: At USP I joined many extracurricular groups and learned how fulfilling it is to help people. I took all kinds of classes — I even enrolled in a quantum physics course, though I dropped it before exams to focus more on programming. After graduating, I had the choice between hardware and software, and I chose software because I believed I could impact more people with it.

values.title: Who I Am Today
values.text: All these different experiences shaped me into a calm, studious, and friendly person. I always try to see other points of view and work to keep the peace wherever I am. Whether it's building software, leading a team, or just having a conversation — I believe empathy and curiosity are the best tools we have.

clearer.role: Team Lead / Senior Full Stack Developer / Scrum Master
bullets: Led two teams as Team Lead (7 developers). Responsible for PR reviews, 1:1 meetings, external meetings, individual goal tracking, Scrum ceremonies, sprint planning and task breakdown in Jira.
Helped manage more than 14 apps to Shopify App Store with tens of thousands of users monthly and total revenue of millions per year.
Created a library with CDK and moved apps from Heroku to AWS to reduce hosting costs and improve architecture management through IaC.
Added unit tests and end-to-end tests using Datadog, allowing faster feature delivery without regressions. Added Codacy for static code analysis.
Added observability with logging and tracing in Datadog, reducing debugging time. Implemented caching with Memcached. Created Lambda functions using DynamoDB and LLMs.
Founder and developer of a startup to help small stores sell online similar to Shopify with ERP, CRM, blog (with SSR) and omnichannel chat.
Built with 3 microservices (auth, core, metrics) in Linux server. Used Github Actions for Blue-Green deployment with Docker and Nginx.
Used React, Node.js, GraphQL, Relay, MongoDB, AWS (S3). Created features using AI with OpenAI, Gemini and Typesense for RAG.
Led two developers and coordinated with designers, social media, lawyers, and consultants.
Setup more than 1,000 unit, integration and end-to-end tests. Created around 600 stores.
Worked at a financial company collecting and maintaining client data for fund investments.
Used Angular and Node for 3 microservices and 2 lambdas, and .NET Core connected with MongoDB cluster.
Moved 1,800 records from manual Excel sheets to an online automated platform, eliminating paper-based workflow.
Delivered the project to external users in 6 months, saving at least one full-time employee of manual effort.
Implemented refresh token, pagination optimization (reducing time to 500ms), and generated 200,000 dynamic PDFs.
Worked at a distance education company using JavaScript frameworks, React and Node with PostgreSQL across 3 main products.
Developed a postgraduate platform from scratch and one for law job positions, both with about 13,000 active students.
Architected front end with Atomic Design for componentization, resulting in easier maintenance.
Built platform connected with an event system using Kafka for user statistics.
Organized company events for promoting integration among members from different teams.
